verses.verse: If <WH3588> a man<WH376> shall steal<WH1589> an ox,<WH7794> or<WH176> a sheep,<WH7716> and kill<WH2873> it, or<WH176> sell<WH4376> it; he shall restore<WH7999> five<WH2568> oxen<WH1241> for<WH8478> an ox,<WH7794> and four<WH702> sheep<WH6629> for<WH8478> a sheep.<WH7716>
If <WH518> a thief<WH1590> be found<WH4672> breaking up,<WH4290> and be smitten<WH5221> that he die,<WH4191> there shall no<WH369> blood<WH1818> be shed for him.

If <WH518> the sun<WH8121> be risen<WH2224> upon<WH5921> him, there shall be blood<WH1818> shed for him; for he should make full restitution;<WH7999> <WH7999> if<WH518> he have nothing,<WH369> then he shall be sold<WH4376> for his theft.<WH1591>

If <WH518> the theft<WH1591> be certainly found<WH4672> <WH4672> in his hand<WH3027> alive,<WH2416> whether it be ox,<WH4480> <WH7794> or<WH5704> ass,<WH2543> or<WH5704> sheep;<WH7716> he shall restore<WH7999> double.<WH8147>

If <WH3588> a man<WH376> shall cause a field<WH7704> or<WH176> vineyard<WH3754> to be eaten,<WH1197> and shall put in<WH7971> <WH853> his beast,<WH1165> and shall feed<WH1197> in another man's<WH312> field;<WH7704> of the best<WH4315> of his own field,<WH7704> and of the best<WH4315> of his own vineyard,<WH3754> shall he make restitution.<WH7999>

If <WH3588> fire<WH784> break out,<WH3318> and catch<WH4672> in thorns,<WH6975> so that the staches of corn,<WH1430> or<WH176> the standing corn,<WH7054> or<WH176> the field,<WH7704> be consumed<WH398> therewith; he that kindled<WH1197> <WH853> the fire<WH1200> shall surely make restitution.<WH7999> <WH7999>

If <WH3588> a man<WH376> shall deliver<WH5414> unto<WH413> his neighbor<WH7453> money<WH3701> or<WH176> stuff<WH3627> to keep,<WH8104> and it be stolen<WH1589> out of the man's house;<WH4480> <WH1004> <WH376> if<WH518> the thief<WH1590> be found,<WH4672> let him pay<WH7999> double.<WH8147>

If <WH518> the thief<WH1590> be not<WH3808> found,<WH4672> then the master<WH1167> of the house<WH1004> shall be brought<WH7126> unto<WH413> the judges,<WH430> to see whether<WH518> <WH3808> he have put<WH7971> his hand<WH3027> unto his neighbor's<WH7453> goods.<WH4399>

For <WH5921> all<WH3605> manner<WH1697> of trespass,<WH6588> whether it be for<WH5921> ox,<WH7794> for<WH5921> ass,<WH2543> for<WH5921> sheep,<WH7716> for<WH5921> raiment,<WH8008> or for<WH5921> any manner<WH3605> of lost thing,<WH9> which<WH834> another challengeth<WH559> to be his,<WH3588> <WH1931> <WH2088> the cause<WH1697> of both parties<WH8147> shall come<WH935> before<WH5704> the judges;<WH430> and whom<WH834> the judges<WH430> shall condemn,<WH7561> he shall pay<WH7999> double<WH8147> unto his neighbor.<WH7453>

If <WH3588> a man<WH376> deliver<WH5414> unto<WH413> his neighbor<WH7453> an ass,<WH2543> or<WH176> an ox,<WH7794> or<WH176> a sheep,<WH7716> or any<WH3605> beast,<WH929> to keep;<WH8104> and it die,<WH4191> or<WH176> be hurt,<WH7665> or<WH176> driven away,<WH7617> no man<WH369> seeing<WH7200> it:

Then shall an oath<WH7621> of the LORD<WH3068> be<WH1961> between<WH996> them both,<WH8147> that<WH518> he hath not<WH3808> put<WH7971> his hand<WH3027> unto his neighbor's<WH7453> goods;<WH4399> and the owner<WH1167> of it shall accept<WH3947> thereof, and he shall not<WH3808> make it good.<WH7999>
And if<WH518> it be stolen<WH1589> <WH1589> from<WH4480> <WH5973> him, he shall make restitution<WH7999> unto the owner<WH1167> thereof.
If <WH518> it be torn in pieces,<WH2963> <WH2963> then let him bring<WH935> it for witness,<WH5707> and he shall not<WH3808> make good<WH7999> that which was torn.<WH2966>

And if<WH3588> a man<WH376> borrow<WH7592> aught of<WH4480> <WH5973> his neighbor,<WH7453> and it be hurt,<WH7665> or<WH176> die,<WH4191> the owner<WH1167> thereof being not<WH369> with<WH5973> it, he shall surely make it good.<WH7999> <WH7999>
But if<WH518> the owner<WH1167> thereof be with<WH5973> it, he shall not<WH3808> make it good:<WH7999> if<WH518> it<WH1931> be a hired<WH7916> thing, it came<WH935> for his hire.<WH7939>

And if<WH3588> a man<WH376> entice<WH6601> a maid<WH1330> that<WH834> is not<WH3808> betrothed,<WH781> and lie<WH7901> with<WH5973> her, he shall surely endow<WH4117> <WH4117> her to be his wife.<WH802>
If <WH518> her father<WH1> utterly refuse<WH3985> <WH3985> to give<WH5414> her unto him, he shall pay<WH8254> money<WH3701> according to the dowry<WH4119> of virgins.<WH1330>
Thou shalt not<WH3808> suffer a witch to live.<WH2421> <WH3784>
Whosoever <WH3605> lieth<WH7901> with<WH5973> a beast<WH929> shall surely be put to death.<WH4191> <WH4191>
He that sacrificeth<WH2076> unto any god,<WH430> save<WH1115> unto the LORD<WH3068> only,<WH905> he shall be utterly destroyed.<WH2763>
Thou shalt neither<WH3808> vex<WH3238> a stranger,<WH1616> nor<WH3808> oppress<WH3905> him: for<WH3588> ye were<WH1961> strangers<WH1616> in the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>
Ye shall not<WH3808> afflict<WH6031> any<WH3605> widow,<WH490> or fatherless child.<WH3490>
If <WH518> thou afflict them in any wise,<WH6031> <WH6031> <WH853> and<WH3588> they cry at all<WH6817> <WH6817> unto<WH413> me, I will surely hear<WH8085> <WH8085> their cry;<WH6818>
And my wrath<WH639> shall wax hot,<WH2734> and I will kill<WH2026> you with the sword;<WH2719> and your wives<WH802> shall be<WH1961> widows,<WH490> and your children<WH1121> fatherless.<WH3490>

If <WH518> thou lend<WH3867> money<WH3701> to any of<WH853> my people<WH5971> that is<WH853> poor<WH6041> by<WH5973> thee, thou shalt not<WH3808> be<WH1961> to him as a usurer,<WH5383> neither<WH3808> shalt thou lay<WH7760> upon<WH5921> him usury.<WH5392>
If <WH518> thou at all take thy neighbor's raiment to pledge,<WH2254> <WH2254> <WH7453> <WH8008> thou shalt deliver<WH7725> it unto him by that<WH5704> the sun<WH8121> goeth down: <WH935>

For <WH3588> that<WH1931> is his covering<WH3682> only,<WH905> it<WH1931> is his raiment<WH8071> for his skin:<WH5785> wherein<WH4100> shall he sleep?<WH7901> and it shall come to pass,<WH1961> when<WH3588> he crieth<WH6817> unto<WH413> me, that I will hear;<WH8085> for<WH3588> I<WH589> am gracious.<WH2587>
Thou shalt not<WH3808> revile<WH7043> the gods,<WH430> nor<WH3808> curse<WH779> the ruler<WH5387> of thy people.<WH5971>
Thou shalt not<WH3808> delay<WH309> to offer the first of thy ripe fruits,<WH4395> and of thy liquors:<WH1831> the firstborn<WH1060> of thy sons<WH1121> shalt thou give<WH5414> unto me.

Likewise <WH3651> shalt thou do<WH6213> with thine oxen,<WH7794> and with thy sheep:<WH6629> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> it shall be<WH1961> with<WH5973> his dam;<WH517> on the eighth<WH8066> day<WH3117> thou shalt give<WH5414> it me.

And ye shall be<WH1961> holy<WH6944> men<WH376> unto me: neither<WH3808> shall ye eat<WH398> any flesh<WH1320> that is torn of beasts<WH2966> in the field;<WH7704> ye shall cast<WH7993> it to the dogs.<WH3611>
